Kassiopeia  3
Monte Carlo simulation program specializing in tracking particles in electric and magnetic fields

1 #include "KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError.h"

3 namespace Kassiopeia

6  double KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError::fEpsilon = 1e-14;
7 
8  KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError::KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError() :
9  fAbsoluteError(1e-12),
10  fSafetyFactor(0.5),
11  fSolverOrder(5),
12  fTimeStep(1),
13  fFirstStep(true)
14  {
15  }
16 
17  KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError::KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError( const KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError& aCopy ) :
18  KSComponent(),
19  fAbsoluteError(aCopy.fAbsoluteError),
20  fSafetyFactor(aCopy.fSafetyFactor),
21  fSolverOrder(aCopy.fSolverOrder),
22  fTimeStep(aCopy.fTimeStep),
23  fFirstStep(aCopy.fFirstStep)
24  {
25  if(fSafetyFactor > 1.0){fSafetyFactor = 1.0/fSafetyFactor;};
26  }
27 
28  KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError* KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError::Clone() const
29  {
30  return new KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError( *this );
31  }
32 
33  KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError::~KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError()
34  {
35  }
36 
37  void KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError::ActivateObject()
38  {
39  if(fSafetyFactor > 1.0){fSafetyFactor = 1.0/fSafetyFactor;};
40  fFirstStep = true;
41  trajmsg_debug( "stepsize momentum numerical error resetting, safety factor is <" <<fSafetyFactor <<"> " << eom );
42  return;
43  }
44 
45  void KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError::Calculate( const KSTrajExactParticle& aParticle, double& aValue )
46  {
47  if( fFirstStep == true )
48  {
49  trajmsg_debug( "stepsize energy on first step" << eom );
50  fTimeStep = 1.0/aParticle.GetCyclotronFrequency();
51  if(fSafetyFactor > 1.0){fSafetyFactor = 1.0/fSafetyFactor;};
52  fFirstStep = false;
53  }
54  trajmsg_debug( "stepsize numerical error suggesting <" << fTimeStep << ">" << eom );
55  aValue = fTimeStep;
56  return;
57  }
58 
59  void KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError::Check( const KSTrajExactParticle& anInitialParticle, const KSTrajExactParticle& aFinalParticle, const KSTrajExactError& anError, bool& aFlag )
60  {
61  fTimeStep = aFinalParticle.GetTime() - anInitialParticle.GetTime();
62  //get Momentum error
63  double momentum_error_mag = (anError.GetMomentumError()).Magnitude();
64  aFlag = UpdateTimeStep(momentum_error_mag);
65  return;
66  }

69  {

80  }

94  {

105  void KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError::Check( const KSTrajAdiabaticSpinParticle& anInitialParticle, const KSTrajAdiabaticSpinParticle& aFinalParticle, const KSTrajAdiabaticSpinError& anError, bool& aFlag )
106  {
107  fTimeStep = aFinalParticle.GetTime() - anInitialParticle.GetTime();
108  //get Momentum error
109  double momentum_error_mag = (anError.GetMomentumError()).Magnitude();
110  aFlag = UpdateTimeStep(momentum_error_mag);
111  return;
112  }
113 
114  void KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError::Calculate( const KSTrajAdiabaticParticle& aParticle, double& aValue )
115  {
116  if( fFirstStep == true )
117  {
118  trajmsg_debug( "stepsize energy on first step" << eom );
119 
120  if( aParticle.GetMagneticField().Magnitude() > 1e-9 )
121  {
122  fTimeStep = 1.0/aParticle.GetCyclotronFrequency();
123  }
124  else
125  {
126  double p = aParticle.GetMomentum().Magnitude();
127  fTimeStep = 100*(fAbsoluteError/p);
128  }
129 
130  if(fSafetyFactor > 1.0){fSafetyFactor = 1.0/fSafetyFactor;};
131  fFirstStep = false;
132  }
133  trajmsg_debug( "stepsize numerical error suggesting <" << fTimeStep << ">" << eom );
134  aValue = fTimeStep;
135  return;
136  }
137 
138  void KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError::Check( const KSTrajAdiabaticParticle& anInitialParticle, const KSTrajAdiabaticParticle& aFinalParticle, const KSTrajAdiabaticError& anError, bool& aFlag )
139  {
140  fTimeStep = aFinalParticle.GetTime() - anInitialParticle.GetTime();
141  //get Momentum magnitude and its error
142  double long_error = anError.GetLongitudinalMomentumError();
143  double trans_error = anError.GetTransverseMomentumError();
144  double momentum_error_mag = std::sqrt( long_error*long_error + trans_error*trans_error );
145  aFlag = UpdateTimeStep(momentum_error_mag);
146  return;
147  }
148 
149  bool KSTrajControlMomentumNumericalError::UpdateTimeStep(double error)
150  {
151  //check to see if the step was acceptable
152  if( error < fAbsoluteError )
153  {
154  if( error < fEpsilon*fAbsoluteError)
155  {
156  //position error is exceedingly small or zero
157  //so we double the stepsize because the normal calculation
158  //for estimating the new stepsize may fail
159  fTimeStep *= 2;
160 // trajmsg_debug( "stepsize position numerical error increasing stepsize from <"<<fTimeStep<<"> to <"<<2*fTimeStep<<"> at position error <" << position_error_mag << ">" << eom) ;
161  return true; //aFlag, step succeeded
162  }
163 
164  //time step is ok, local error does not exceed bounds
165  //estimate the next time step
166  double beta = error/std::pow(fTimeStep, fSolverOrder);
167  double updatedTimeStep = fSafetyFactor*std::pow( fAbsoluteError/beta , 1.0/fSolverOrder);
168 // trajmsg_debug( "stepsize position numerical error increasing stepsize from <"<<fTimeStep<<"> to <"<<updatedTimeStep<<"> at position error <" << position_error_mag << ">" << eom) ;
169  fTimeStep = updatedTimeStep;
170  return true; //aFlag, step succeeded
171  }
172  else
173  {
174  //local error is too large so we need to decrease the time step
175  //estimate the next time step
176  double beta = error/std::pow(fTimeStep, fSolverOrder);
177  double updatedTimeStep = fSafetyFactor*std::pow( fAbsoluteError/beta , 1.0/fSolverOrder);
178 // trajmsg_debug( "stepsize position numerical error decreasing stepsize from <"<<fTimeStep<<"> to <"<<updatedTimeStep<<"> at position error <" << position_error_mag << ">" << eom) ;
179  fTimeStep = updatedTimeStep;
180  return false; //aFlag, step failed
181  }
182 
183  }
